title: Star of Bethlehem
verses: When marshall'd on the night-ly plain, The star a-lone, of all the train, Can one a-lone, the Sav-ior speaks, It
glittering hosts be-stud the sky, One fix the sin-ner's wand'ring eye:
Hark! hark! to God the cho-rus breaks, From ev'-ry host, from ev'-ry gem; But

metadata.musical_notation: Present with treble and bass clef
metadata.theological_significance: Commemorates the star that guided the wise men to Jesus
